Basic role names, the actual permission will come as features are finished, fo this ticket just use the name and the rest as a description.

Integrate push notification code into OnDemand Application:

Andrew Demski 15:15
Hey, I’m getting the file but for push notifications we have it setup at http://ec2-3-222-215-191.compute-1.amazonaws.com/backend/notification.php?fcm_token=token and all you need to do to send that notification to the user is put the token in, you grab the token from firebase under that user its label as push_token

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"1"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1594326606509"},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["On-Demand Project"],"valueId":["On-Demand Project"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"garthpmurray","fullName":"Garth Murray"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"4-104","author":"garthpmurray","authorFullName":"Garth Murray","issueId":"OD-75","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
PHP

if (isset($_GET['fcm_token']) && !empty($_GET['fcm_token'])) {
    
    $registration_id = isset($_GET['fcm_token']) && !empty($_GET['fcm_token']) ? $_GET['fcm_token'] : '';
    
    $fields = [
        
        'registration_ids' => [$registration_id],
        
        'data' => [
            
            'message' => 'You have been assigned a new claim',
            
            'title' => 'Claim Assigned',
        
        ],
    
    ];
    
    $headers = [
        'Authorization: key=AAAAzf7YaO8:APA91bHbgKv_5f1FdC6sp_JNmTA3yAeC0CUEcgiXeVFdXvyZHE9pCV9WLG_bL0W_Ml4_SwwNEKkMoZPJnrR4lbSHIyMFiTGOuy5XM1h_im_7DhrU7mB9briXQwuxIuzq13yG0JhLTGTF',
        
        'Content-Type: application/json',
    
    ];
    
    $ch = curl_init();
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, 'https://fcm.googleapis.com/fcm/send');
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, TRUE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 0);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, FALSE);
    
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($fields));
    
    $result = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($result === FALSE) {
        response(400, "Something went wrong");
    }
    
    curl_close($ch);
    $explode = explode(",", $result);
    $new_exp = explode(":", $explode[1]);
    if ($new_exp[1] == 0) {
        response(400, "Incorrect Token");
    } else {
        response(200, "Notification sent successfully.");
    }
} else {
    response(400, "FCM token required");
}

function response ($status, $status_message) {
    header("HTTP/1.1 " . $status);
    
    $response['status'] = $status;
    $response['message'] = $status_message;
    
    $json_response = json_encode($response);
    echo $json_response;
}

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Rick Dupont"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"rdupont"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1594147642936"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"BRSRC-13","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["Init Sprint"],"valueId":["Init Sprint"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Frontend Design"],"valueId":["Frontend Design"],"color":{"bg":"#d8f7f3","fg":"#45818e"}},{"name":"Ideal days","value":["2"],"valueId":["2"],"color":null},{"name":"Story points","value":["2"],"valueId":["2"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"rdupont","fullName":"Rick Dupont"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"BRSRC-13","entityId":"2-431","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"BRSRC"},{"name":"summary","value":"Metronic Theme"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1594142349213"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"13"},{"name":"description","value":"

We've purchased the Metronic Theme from themeforest.com and will be utilizing that for our frontend design.

Initially the basic setup should be able to pinpoint what are the necessary files needed for us to start building with this theme

Metronic ships with a version of it's theme tailored for Laravel, however it also depends heavily on Node.js to run. We won't be utilizing Node at this stage. So while we can utilize the Laravel setup as a guideline, we will be building most of the template from scratch.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Rick Dupont"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"garthpmurray"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"0"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"rdupont"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1594147638471"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"BRSRC-14","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"},{"value":"BRSRC-15","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":null},{"name":"Sprints","value":["Init Sprint"],"valueId":["Init Sprint"],"color":null},{"name":"Type","value":["User Story"],"valueId":["User Story"],"color":null},{"name":"Priority","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Subsystem","value":["Frontend Design"],"valueId":["Frontend Design"],"color":{"bg":"#d8f7f3","fg":"#45818e"}},{"name":"Story points","value":["5"],"valueId":["5"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"rdupont","fullName":"Rick Dupont"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"BS-83","entityId":"2-427","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"BS"},{"name":"summary","value":"Users Data table missing from export query"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Rick Dupont"},{"name":"created","value":"1593719026017"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"83"},{"name":"description","value":"

https://wxdata.com

use the Storm Report Api

Pull in weather data for the city, state with the date range of $assignment->loss_date +- 10 days

Save whole response in the api status table
Create new table to hold per assignment table
Api response will return multiple reading locations, determine the closest reading location and store that data in the per assignments table
